metadata.journal: Journal of Oral and Maxillofacial Research

abstract.first_50_chars: Objectives: The objective of the present systemati

introduction.heading: Introduction
introduction.first_sentence: Placement of standard-length implants in the posterior maxilla is frequently compromised or impossible due to atrophy of the alveolar ridge and pneumatization of the maxillary sinus.
introduction.first_100_chars: Placement of standard-length implants in the posterior maxilla is frequently compromised or impossib
introduction.last_sentence: A rough guide to the interpretation of I2 given in the Cochrane Handbook for Systematic Reviews of Interventions is as follows: (1) at 0 to 40% the heterogeneity might not be important, (2) 30 to 60% may represent moderate heterogeneity, (3) 50 to 90
introduction.last_100_chars: sent substantial heterogeneity, and (4) 75 to 100% may represent considerable heterogeneity [17,18].

results.heading: Results
results.first_sentence: Study selection Search results are outlined in Figure 1.
results.first_100_chars: Study selection Search results are outlined in Figure 1. Electronic search resulted in 175 entries.
results.last_sentence: (Table 3) Summary Comparable pain intensity scale score was reported following TSMEOD compared with OMSFE, while TSMEOD was associated with less pain, numbers of days with medication usage, and improved immediate oral-health related quality of life c
results.last_100_chars: ediate oral-health related quality of life compared with MSFA applying the lateral window technique.
subsections: Procedure for randomization was reported in four
Procedure for allocation concealment was specified
Blinding of participants were reported in one study
Duration of surgery was statistically significant

discussion.heading: Discussion
discussion.first_sentence: The objective of the present systematic review was to test the hypothesis of no difference in implant treatment outcome following TSMEOD compared with OMSFE or MSFA applying the lateral window J Oral Maxillofac Res 2025 (Apr-Jun) | vol.
discussion.first_100_chars: The objective of the present systematic review was to test the hypothesis of no difference in implan
discussion.last_sentence: Consequently, the conclusions provided from the results of the present systematic review seems to be inadequate to propose implications for evidence based clinical guidelines according to the focus question of the present systematic review.
discussion.last_100_chars: evidence based clinical guidelines according to the focus question of the present systematic review.

conclusions.heading: Conclusions
conclusions.first_sentence: Placement of standard-length implants in conjunction with transcrestal maxillary sinus membrane elevation using osseodensification are associated J Oral Maxillofac Res 2025 (Apr-Jun) | vol.
conclusions.first_100_chars: Placement of standard-length implants in conjunction with transcrestal maxillary sinus membrane elev
conclusions.last_sentence: Hence, conclusions drawn from results of this systematic review should be interpreted with pronounced caution and further longterm randomized controlled trials involving larger patient samples, peri-implant marginal bone loss, and endo-sinus bone gai
conclusions.last_100_chars: marginal bone loss, and endo-sinus bone gain are needed before definite conclusions can be provided.
